articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in D# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in D# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord in D# with the C shape is a rich and sophisticated chord that adds color and depth to music. It consists of a root note (D#), major third (G#), perfect fifth (C), major seventh (C#), ninth (F), eleventh (A#), and thirteenth (D#). When played in the C shape, this chord has a unique and full sound that can enhance various musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- D# (Root)
- G# (Major Third)
- C (Perfect Fifth)
- C# (Major Seventh)
- F (Ninth)
- A# (Eleventh)
- D# (Thirteenth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in D# with the C shape is often used in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to compositions, creating a sense of richness and complexity. This chord is commonly found in smooth jazz ballads, soulful R&B tracks, and experimental jazz pieces.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 13th chord in D# with the C shape:
1. Song: "Misty" by Erroll Garner
2. Song: "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
3. Song: "Compared to What" by Les McCann and Eddie Harris
